Package calculators

Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
calculators.Calculator
Direct Known Subclasses:
CalculatorAdvanced
public class Calculator
extends java.lang.Object

Calculator

This class simulates a simple calculator which encapsulates a single variable named currentValue. currentValue represents a result produced by performing various arithmetic operations. Supported arithmetic operations: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division.
Since:
2021-2-12
Version:
1.0
Author:
zoran pantos

    Instantiates object of type Calculator and sets starting value to 0.

  • Method Details

    • getCurrentValue

      public java.lang.Double getCurrentValue()
      Used for fetching starting value of Calculator class or arithmetic operation result if one is executed.

    • setCurrentValue

      public void setCurrentValue​(java.lang.Double currentValue)
      Used for setting starting value of Calculator class.
      Parameters:
      currentValue - starting value upon which arithmetic operation will be performed

    • calculate

      public void calculate​(java.lang.Double value, char operator) throws DivisionByZeroException, NotSupportedOperationException
      Used for performing given arithmetic operation with currentValue as first operand and value as second operand.
      Parameters:
      value - second operand
      operator - arithmetic operation to be executed
      Throws:
      DivisionByZeroException - if value is 0
      NotSupportedOperationException - if operator is not from set { +, -, *, / }
